title: Add red alarm-style feedback when the 'No' button is clicked

requirements.text: Update the Valentine question screen so the "No" button is enabled and, when clicked, triggers a noticeable red "alarm" visual feedback (e.g., button turns red with a red ring/glow and shakes, and/or a brief red screen flash overlay) without navigating away from the question screen.

quotes: can you add that whenever it clicked no it shows red like alarm

acceptanceCriteria: On the Question screen, the "No" button is clickable (not disabled).
Clicking "No" does not transition to the gifts screen and does not refresh the page.
After clicking "No", a clearly visible alarm-like red feedback occurs (red styling + motion/flash) and then returns to the normal state automatically after a short duration (e.g., ~1â€“2 seconds).
The effect can be triggered repeatedly on subsequent clicks without breaking the layout.

requirements.text: Add any required CSS (keyframes/utility classes) to support the red alarm feedback animation(s) used by the "No" click behavior, using the existing Tailwind/global styling approach in this project.

quotes: can you add that whenever it clicked no it shows red like alarm

acceptanceCriteria: The alarm animation styles are defined in project styles (e.g., frontend/src/index.css and/or Tailwind configuration) and are applied via class names in the Question screen component.
The animation works in both light and dark mode and remains readable/accessible (no permanent high-contrast flashing; effect is brief).

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI primitives).
Do not modify any files listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts/tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
Keep all backend logic unchanged (no backend changes required for this UI-only behavior).
nonGoals: Adding new backend endpoints or storing the "No" click event.
Changing the existing "Yes" flow behavior or gift navigation beyond what is required to keep "No" on the question screen.
